body_html:
I am wondering if it makes sense to just add an optional compression flag to decode_raw?

At the moment compression are supported in some of the classes and there are some PRs pending, like #14599, #12369, #14342. There is no dedicated compressed format process. Rather compression are treated as an optional layer on top of TFRecord, TextLineRecord, etc.

Maybe we could just do the same so that we have

decode_raw(
    bytes,
    out_type,
    little_endian=True,
    name=None,
    compression="NONE"
)

with compression = "NONE"/"ZLIB"/"GZIP"/etc supported?

body:
I am wondering if it makes sense to just add an optional `compression` flag to `decode_raw`?

At the moment compression are supported in  some of the classes and there are some PRs pending,  like #14599, #12369, #14342. There is no dedicated `compressed format` process. Rather compression are treated as an optional layer on top of  `TFRecord`, `TextLineRecord`, etc.

Maybe we could just do the same so that we have
```
decode_raw(
    bytes,
    out_type,
    little_endian=True,
    name=None,
    compression="NONE"
)

```
with compression = `"NONE"`/`"ZLIB"`/`"GZIP"`/etc supported?
